title: Is it dangerous to talk on the phone for a long time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on what other needed activities don’t get done while you’re occupying your time in casual conversations. This kind of chat is certainly common enough in kids — but in adults, I’d find it a bit odd. There are only so many hours in our days. If you’re not spending them in productive or constructive activity, then you’re growing as deeply as you could be or accomplishing as much. Of course, realize that I’m also a 75 year old village elder (now retired, thus available to chat here on Quora) who grew up poor and didn’t watch television until my teen years because we didn’t have one. So I’ve never had “too much time on my hands”. It sounds to me like maybe you do have too much time on your hands.

Yes. It is. If you have talk for long times you can use a earphone/ headphone to minimize damage. But prolonged use of earphone or headphone is also isn't good for ears. The best way is to old landline phones if you have to talk long. I know it sound a bit old school but is the best way to talk long.

An even more common side effect: Using your phone too much can cause inflammation in your tendons and enhance existing conditions, like tendinitis and carpal tunnel. Similarly, "Cell Phone Elbow" describes tingling or numbness in ring and pinky fingers after bending your elbow for long periods of time.
